AI Chatbot Project Charter

Project Charter: AI Customer Service Chatbot

Executive Summary

Project Details
Project Name RetailFlow AI Customer Service Chatbot Pilot
Budget AUD $150,000
Timeline 6 months (24 weeks)
Sponsor Emma Rodriguez, CEO
Project Manager External Consultant (You)
Key Objectives
  • Reduce email response time from 26 hours to < 4 hours
  • Improve customer satisfaction from 68% to 78%
  • Handle 40% of routine customer inquiries automatically
  • Reduce customer service operational costs by 25%

Problem Statement

Current Crisis

RetailFlow's customer service is in crisis with email response times at 26 hours (far exceeding the 4-hour target) and customer satisfaction at 68% (below the 78% target). This is impacting customer retention and brand reputation.

26 hrs

Current Email Response Time

Target: < 4 hours

68%

Customer Satisfaction

Target: 78%

200+

Customer Service Staff

Experiencing burnout

Proposed Solution

AI-Powered Customer Service Chatbot

Implementation of an intelligent chatbot system to handle routine customer inquiries, provide instant responses, and escalate complex issues to human agents when necessary.

Key Features
  • 24/7 availability
  • Natural language processing
  • Integration with existing systems
  • Multi-language support
  • Order tracking and status updates
  • Product information and recommendations
  • Return and refund processing
  • Seamless human handoff

Success Metrics

Metric Current Target (6 months) Measurement Method
Email Response Time 26 hours < 4 hours Help desk analytics
Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) 68% 78% Post-interaction surveys
First Contact Resolution 45% 65% CRM tracking
Operational Cost AUD $50K/month AUD $37.5K/month Financial reports
Chatbot Adoption Rate 0% 40% of inquiries Usage analytics

Scope

In Scope
  • Chatbot development and implementation
  • Integration with existing CRM and order management systems
  • Training for customer service team
  • Customer communication and change management
  • Performance monitoring and optimization
Out of Scope
  • Complete replacement of human customer service team
  • Major redesign of existing IT infrastructure
  • Implementation of additional AI technologies
  • Expansion to international markets

Risk Assessment

High Risk
  • Customer acceptance and adoption
  • Integration complexity with legacy systems
  • Data privacy and security concerns
Medium Risk
  • Staff resistance and training challenges
  • Budget overruns
  • Technology performance issues

Stakeholder Analysis

Stakeholder Interest Influence Key Concerns
Emma Rodriguez (CEO) High High Brand reputation, customer satisfaction
David Chen (CFO) Medium High ROI, cost savings, budget adherence
Sarah Thompson (COO) High High Service quality, staff impact
Marcus Kim (CIO) High Medium Technical implementation, security
Customer Service Team High Medium Job security, workload changes
